newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Bucharest stocks mixed, volumes keep low.
newsitem.headline: Bucharest stocks mixed, volumes keep low.

text.p: Bucharest shares drifted without clear direction on Tuesday, with volumes keeping light and turnover staying close to the previous 68 million lei level.
Volume was 11,733 shares on turnover of 66.2 million lei.
"Interest is thin and turnover will probably be around 100 million lei till the market turns more liquid," a trader said.
The market was expected to become more liquid in the not too distant future.
"With the completion of distribution of shareholders' certificates under the mass selloff scheme more people will bring listed shares to trading," the trader said.

Most of the 13 companies traded on the Bursa de Valori Bucuresti were included in a mass privatisation programme which offered adult Romanians up to 60 percent of some 4,000 state companies in exchange for vouchers and coupons.
The bulk of the new shareholders are expected to rush to the stock exchange to sell shares.
"There are stocks for which demand has almost always been high so the new offer will find a match," said another trader.
On Tuesday, fertiliser maker Azomures SA remained a top performer by value traded, taking 43 percent of turnover. It closed slightly lower at 12,000 lei from 12,100.
Artrom SA engineer dominated the bourse in share volume. Some 4,600 Artrom shares changed hands. The stock closed 50 lei stronger at 2,600.
Tuesday's novelty was an extension of continuous trading by one and a half hours after a pre-market pricing session was cut to half an hour. Traders said the move was beneficial.
"If you have an order to fulfil and you find no client you surely have more time now to try to find one," said a trader.

The unofficial VAB Index -- a value-weighted index of all stocks computed by Vanguard SA securities -- was 0.66 percent higher from the previous session, closing at 373.5 points. Its base was 1,000 points when it was created last November.
Aug 27 Aug 22 Week's change 1996 high 1996 low
